trans-unit.source: Diagnose failures and exceptions in ASP.NET apps with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Diagnose failures and exceptions in ASP.NET apps with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Configure your app to get a compelling diagnostic experience by capturing exceptions along with request telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Configure your app to get a compelling diagnostic experience by capturing exceptions along with request telemetry.

trans-unit.source: By monitoring your application with <linkText>Visual Studio Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title>, you can correlate failed requests with exceptions and other events at both the client and server, so that you can quickly diagnose the causes.
trans-unit.target: By monitoring your application with <linkText>Visual Studio Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title>, you can correlate failed requests with exceptions and other events at both the client and server, so that you can quickly diagnose the causes.

trans-unit.source: To monitor an ASP.NET app, you have to <linkText>add Application Insights SDK[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title> to your application, or <linkText>install Status Monitor on your IIS server[redfield]</linkText><title></title>, or, if your app is an Azure Web App, add the <linkText>Application Insights Extension[azure]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To monitor an ASP.NET app, you have to <linkText>add Application Insights SDK[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title> to your application, or <linkText>install Status Monitor on your IIS server[redfield]</linkText><title></title>, or, if your app is an Azure Web App, add the <linkText>Application Insights Extension[azure]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: From the overview blade, the Failures tile shows you charts of exceptions and failed HTTP requests, together with a list of the request URLs that cause the most frequent failures.
trans-unit.target: From the overview blade, the Failures tile shows you charts of exceptions and failed HTTP requests, together with a list of the request URLs that cause the most frequent failures.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Failures</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Failures</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click through one of the failed request types in the list to get to individual occurrences of the failure.
trans-unit.target: Click through one of the failed request types in the list to get to individual occurrences of the failure.

trans-unit.source: From there, click through to the exceptions or any trace data associated with it:
trans-unit.target: From there, click through to the exceptions or any trace data associated with it:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select an instance of a failed request, and under exception details, get to instances of the exception.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select an instance of a failed request, and under exception details, get to instances of the exception.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can start from the list of exceptions that you'll find further down the Failures blade.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can start from the list of exceptions that you'll find further down the Failures blade.

trans-unit.source: Keep clicking until you eventually get to individual exceptions.
trans-unit.target: Keep clicking until you eventually get to individual exceptions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>

trans-unit.source: *No exceptions showing?
trans-unit.target: *No exceptions showing?

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Capture exceptions</linkText><title></title>.*
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Capture exceptions</linkText><title></title>.*

trans-unit.source: From there you can look at the stack trace and detailed properties of each exception and find related log trace or other events.
trans-unit.target: From there you can look at the stack trace and detailed properties of each exception and find related log trace or other events.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A dependency is a service that your application calls, typically through a REST API or database connection.
trans-unit.target: A dependency is a service that your application calls, typically through a REST API or database connection.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Insights Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title> automatically monitors a variety of types of dependency call, measuring call duration and success or failure.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Insights Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title> automatically monitors a variety of types of dependency call, measuring call duration and success or failure.

trans-unit.source: To get dependency data, you have to <linkText>install Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title> on your IIS server, or if your app is an Azure Web App, use the <linkText>Application Insights Extension[azure]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To get dependency data, you have to <linkText>install Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title> on your IIS server, or if your app is an Azure Web App, use the <linkText>Application Insights Extension[azure]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can do this either
trans-unit.target: You can do this either

trans-unit.source: Failed calls to dependencies are listed on the Failures blade, and you can also find them under Related Items in the request details and exception details.
trans-unit.target: Failed calls to dependencies are listed on the Failures blade, and you can also find them under Related Items in the request details and exception details.

trans-unit.source: *No dependency failures?
trans-unit.target: *No dependency failures?

trans-unit.source: That's good.
trans-unit.target: That's good.

trans-unit.source: But to verify that you're getting dependency data, open the Performance blade and look at the Dependency Duration chart.*
trans-unit.target: But to verify that you're getting dependency data, open the Performance blade and look at the Dependency Duration chart.*

trans-unit.source: To get diagnostic data specific to your app, you can insert code to send your own telemetry data.
trans-unit.target: To get diagnostic data specific to your app, you can insert code to send your own telemetry data.

trans-unit.source: This displayed in diagnostic search alongside the request, page view and other automatically-collected data.
trans-unit.target: This displayed in diagnostic search alongside the request, page view and other automatically-collected data.

trans-unit.source: You have several options:
trans-unit.target: You have several options:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TrackEvent()</linkText><title></title> is typically used for monitoring usage patterns, but the data it sends also appears under Custom Events in diagnostic search.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TrackEvent()</linkText><title></title> is typically used for monitoring usage patterns, but the data it sends also appears under Custom Events in diagnostic search.

trans-unit.source: Events are named, and can carry string properties and numeric metrics on which you can <linkText>filter your diagnostic searches[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Events are named, and can carry string properties and numeric metrics on which you can <linkText>filter your diagnostic searches[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TrackTrace()</linkText><title></title> lets you send longer data such as POST information.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TrackTrace()</linkText><title></title> lets you send longer data such as POST information.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TrackException()</linkText><title></title> sends stack traces.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TrackException()</linkText><title></title> sends stack traces.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>More about exceptions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>More about exceptions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you already use a logging framework like Log4Net or NLog, you can <linkText>capture those logs[netlogs]</linkText><title></title> and see them in diagnostic search alongside request and exception data.
trans-unit.target: If you already use a logging framework like Log4Net or NLog, you can <linkText>capture those logs[netlogs]</linkText><title></title> and see them in diagnostic search alongside request and exception data.

trans-unit.source: To see these events, open <linkText>Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>, open Filter, and then choose Custom Event, Trace, or Exception.
trans-unit.target: To see these events, open <linkText>Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>, open Filter, and then choose Custom Event, Trace, or Exception.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Request details don't include the data sent to your app in a POST call.
trans-unit.target: Request details don't include the data sent to your app in a POST call.

trans-unit.source: To have this data reported:
trans-unit.target: To have this data reported:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install the SDK[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title> in your application project.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install the SDK[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title> in your application project.

trans-unit.source: Insert code in your application to call <linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TrackTrace()[api]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Insert code in your application to call <linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TrackTrace()[api]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Send the POST data in the message parameter.
trans-unit.target: Send the POST data in the message parameter.

trans-unit.source: There is a limit to the permitted size, so you should try to send just the essential data.
trans-unit.target: There is a limit to the permitted size, so you should try to send just the essential data.

trans-unit.source: When you investigate a failed request, find the associated traces.
trans-unit.target: When you investigate a failed request, find the associated traces.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drill through</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At first, you won't see in the portal all the exceptions that cause failures in your app.
trans-unit.target: At first, you won't see in the portal all the exceptions that cause failures in your app.

trans-unit.source: You'll see any browser exceptions (if you're using the <linkText>JavaScript SDK[client]</linkText><title></title> in your web pages).
trans-unit.target: You'll see any browser exceptions (if you're using the <linkText>JavaScript SDK[client]</linkText><title></title> in your web pages).

trans-unit.source: But most server exceptions are caught by IIS and you have to write a bit of code to see them.
trans-unit.target: But most server exceptions are caught by IIS and you have to write a bit of code to see them.

trans-unit.source: You can:
trans-unit.target: You can:

trans-unit.source: Log exceptions explicitly by inserting code in exception handlers to report the exceptions.
trans-unit.target: Log exceptions explicitly by inserting code in exception handlers to report the exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Capture exceptions automatically by configuring your ASP.NET framework.
trans-unit.target: Capture exceptions automatically by configuring your ASP.NET framework.

trans-unit.source: The necessary additions are different for different types of framework.
trans-unit.target: The necessary additions are different for different types of framework.

trans-unit.source: The simplest way is to insert a call to TrackException() in an exception handler.
trans-unit.target: The simplest way is to insert a call to TrackException() in an exception handler.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript
trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: C#
trans-unit.target: C#

trans-unit.source: VB
trans-unit.target: VB

trans-unit.source: The properties and measurements parameters are optional, but are useful for <linkText>filtering and adding[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> extra information.
trans-unit.target: The properties and measurements parameters are optional, but are useful for <linkText>filtering and adding[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> extra information.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have an app that can run several games, you could find all the exception reports related to a particular game.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have an app that can run several games, you could find all the exception reports related to a particular game.

trans-unit.source: You can add as many items as you like to each dictionary.
trans-unit.target: You can add as many items as you like to each dictionary.

trans-unit.source: Most browser exceptions are reported.
trans-unit.target: Most browser exceptions are reported.

trans-unit.source: If your web page includes script files from content delivery networks or other domains, ensure your script tag has the attribute crossorigin="anonymous", and that the server sends CORS headers.
trans-unit.target: If your web page includes script files from content delivery networks or other domains, ensure your script tag has the attribute crossorigin="anonymous", and that the server sends CORS headers.

trans-unit.source: This will allow you to get a stack trace and detail for unhandled JavaScript exceptions from these resources.
trans-unit.target: This will allow you to get a stack trace and detail for unhandled JavaScript exceptions from these resources.

trans-unit.source: For web forms, the HTTP Module will be able to collect the exceptions when there are no redirects configured with CustomErrors.
trans-unit.target: For web forms, the HTTP Module will be able to collect the exceptions when there are no redirects configured with CustomErrors.

trans-unit.source: But if you have active redirects, add the following lines to the Application_Error function in Global.asax.cs.
trans-unit.target: But if you have active redirects, add the following lines to the Application_Error function in Global.asax.cs.

trans-unit.source: (Add a Global.asax file if you don't already have one.)
trans-unit.target: (Add a Global.asax file if you don't already have one.)

trans-unit.source: C#
trans-unit.target: C#

trans-unit.source: If the CustomErrors configuration is Off, then exceptions will be available for the HTTP Module to collect.
trans-unit.target: If the CustomErrors configuration is Off, then exceptions will be available for the HTTP Module to collect.

trans-unit.source: However, if it is RemoteOnly (default), or On, then the exception will be cleared and not available for Application Insights to automatically collect.
trans-unit.target: However, if it is RemoteOnly (default), or On, then the exception will be cleared and not available for Application Insights to automatically collect.

trans-unit.source: You can fix that by overriding the <linkText>System.Web.Mvc.HandleErrorAttribute class</linkText><title></title>, and applying the overridden class as shown for the different MVC versions below (<linkText>github source</linkText><title></title>):
trans-unit.target: You can fix that by overriding the <linkText>System.Web.Mvc.HandleErrorAttribute class</linkText><title></title>, and applying the overridden class as shown for the different MVC versions below (<linkText>github source</linkText><title></title>):

trans-unit.source: Replace the HandleError attribute with your new attribute in your controllers.
trans-unit.target: Replace the HandleError attribute with your new attribute in your controllers.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sample</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Register AiHandleErrorAttribute as a global filter in Global.asax.cs:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sample</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Register AiHandleErrorAttribute as a global filter in FilterConfig.cs:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sample</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Override System.Web.Http.Filters.ExceptionFilterAttribute:
trans-unit.target: Override System.Web.Http.Filters.ExceptionFilterAttribute:

trans-unit.source: You could add this overridden attribute to specific controllers, or add it to the global filter configuration in the WebApiConfig class:
trans-unit.target: You could add this overridden attribute to specific controllers, or add it to the global filter configuration in the WebApiConfig class:

trans-unit.target: [Sample](https://github.com/AppInsightsSamples/WebApi1.xUnhandledExceptions)

trans-unit.source: There are a number of cases that the exception filters cannot handle.
trans-unit.target: There are a number of cases that the exception filters cannot handle.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Exceptions thrown from controller constructors.
trans-unit.target: Exceptions thrown from controller constructors.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions thrown from message handlers.
trans-unit.target: Exceptions thrown from message handlers.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions thrown during routing.
trans-unit.target: Exceptions thrown during routing.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions thrown during response content serialization.
trans-unit.target: Exceptions thrown during response content serialization.

trans-unit.source: Add an implementation of IExceptionLogger:
trans-unit.target: Add an implementation of IExceptionLogger:

trans-unit.source: Add this to the services in WebApiConfig:
trans-unit.target: Add this to the services in WebApiConfig:

trans-unit.target: [Sample](https://github.com/AppInsightsSamples/WebApi2.xUnhandledExceptions)

trans-unit.source: As alternatives, you could:
trans-unit.target: As alternatives, you could:

trans-unit.source: Replace the only ExceptionHandler with a custom implementation of IExceptionHandler.
trans-unit.target: Replace the only ExceptionHandler with a custom implementation of IExceptionHandler.

trans-unit.source: This is only called when the framework is still able to choose which response message to send (not when the connection is aborted for instance)
trans-unit.target: This is only called when the framework is still able to choose which response message to send (not when the connection is aborted for instance)

trans-unit.source: Exception Filters (as described in the section on Web API 1.x controllers above) - not called in all cases.
trans-unit.target: Exception Filters (as described in the section on Web API 1.x controllers above) - not called in all cases.

trans-unit.source: Add a class that extends Attribute and implements IErrorHandler and IServiceBehavior.
trans-unit.target: Add a class that extends Attribute and implements IErrorHandler and IServiceBehavior.
